gameFiles

Class HighScoreManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameFiles.HighScoreManager

  • public class HighScoreManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main class for handling highscores. This manages checking for new highscores, saving the scores, and importing scores.
    Version:
    v4.0 June 12th, 2014
    Author:
    Jason P'ng

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) static java.lang.String HIGHSCORES
      Constant name for the file that keeps all the high scores.
      static java.util.ArrayList<HighScore> scores
      This keeps all the high scores.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HighScoreManager()
      This is the main constructor of the class responsible for importing the high scores.

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • importFile

        public void importFile(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method imports the file.
        For loop reads in 3 lines ten times for the ten highscores. There will always be thirty lines in the highscore file
        Any error results in a new blank file being created.
        Parameters:
        String - fileName This is the name of the file.
        BufferedReader - in This is a reference to the BufferedReader class.
        String - name This is the name of the high score person.
        int - score This is the score of the high score person.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - e Catches any mistakes in the file.
        java.io.IOException - e Prevents the program from crashing due to a corrupted file.

      • writeFile

        public static void writeFile()
        This method writes back to the file to update the scores.
        The for loop is to repeat the process of writing for the entirety of the highscore array.
        Parameters:
        PrintWriter - out This is a reference to the PrintWriter class.
        HighScore - score This is the score of a player.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e This catches an error in reading the highscore file.

      • writeBlankFile

        public static void writeBlankFile()
        This method writes a blank file if one does not exist.
        for loop is to repeate the process of writing a blank highscore 10 times.
        Parameters:
        PrintWriter - out This is a reference to the PrintWriter class.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e This catches an error in reading the highscore file.

      • getScores

        public static java.util.ArrayList<HighScore> getScores()
        returns the current scores.
        Returns:
        the array list of highscores.

      • clearScores

        public void clearScores()
        clears the current scores and writes a new blank file.

      • checkScores

        public int checkScores(int score)
        This method checks to see if a score makes a high score list.
        Parameters:
        int - score This sends a score to check.
        Returns:
        the placement of the score in the highscore table. -1 is returned if the score is not in the highscores.
